Keywords: Avengers , Robot , Ruler , Scientist
Real Name: Ultron
Special Powers
GALACTIC GENOCIDE IN THE NAME OF THE AVENGERS: When an opposing character that is part of a themed team uses Probability Control, after resolutions deal that character 1 unavoidable damage.
WE CAN REWRITE THE ENTIRE UNIVERSE!: When Ultron Pym starts the game, the opponent generates 3 Infinity markers in distinct squares in their starting area and 3 Infinity markers into any distinct squares on the map. Each Infinity marker must be at least 3 squares from all others. // POWER: Remove an Infinity marker from a square occupied by a friendly character with "Ultron" in its name and place it on this card. If you did, after resolutions gain 1 MISSION POINT for each Infinity marker on this card.
JARVIS HERE DID MOST OF THE WORK: Leadership, Mastermind. When Ultron Pym uses Leadership and succeeds, in addition to normal effects, generate an Ultron Drone bystander.
Trade Ultron Pym Want Ultron Pym

affe053b Ultron Pym vs Pulse Wave + PC

Comments
January 17, 2022
FreePineapple
I've played this Ultron around 10 times in different styles and he's been a 10/10 figure in each game. Great stats, solid powers and an ability to do something impactful almost every turn. Dealing with him is also such a pain for your opponent because of the Power Cosmic + Mastermind + potential to spawn Ultron Drones. He's a great candidate for the Reign Of Terror map bonus. In the case of Mission Points, I don't think there's much for competitive viability. It takes too many actions and too much time to accomplish. I definitely prefer just playing him on a more standard team, but the Mission Points are awesome casually. I've also had a lot of fun with Scientist themes and I'm looking forward to Avengers builds when War of the Realms releases!
January 5, 2022
tidge
You (re)count the already collected number markers every time you collect a marker. It's like a mathematical "factorial", but for addition of integers instead of multiplication of integers. "Making the game easy!" is our motto!
January 5, 2022
The Singularity
I'm confused... How do you get 21 mission points from this? 6 infinity markers = 6 mission points right? Am I missing something?
December 21, 2021
fastcat99
What a neat way to use Mission points! At least until some joker figures out how to give a bunch of Ultrons Hypersonic and then the game is over superquick. :(
December 17, 2021
tidge
The Infinity Markers are simply a distraction for all players. The location of them, plus the requirement to use a POWER action to seize them make it impractical to plan to ever collect them in standard play. The 2021 dial designs and 2020 rules don't necessarily mean that taking 1 unavoidable is a bad thing, but it will give many players of theme teams pause before casually using Probability Control (from any source). The Avengers keyword offers peculiar team possibilities. I'm most excited by what this figure brings to "Ultron" teams, especially for the cost.
December 8, 2021
Goop
So if you can pick up the 6 markers thats 21pts and you win the game. Its much harder than it looks though. Opponent gets to place them and you have to power action to grab em. I'm sure everyone will be running him just for his counter to prob, thats the money with him. Forget that whole mission point stuff. For 80pts being able to completely screw your opponents probability no matter where they are, thats really nice. Also extremely hard to kill with mastermind/impervious/cosmic energy.
